page.title: 14PRESENT DAY INDUSTRY
page.content: RHONDDA SPECIALIZED IN COAL REACHING ITS PEAK IN 1913.AS THERE WAS NO OTHER INDUSTRY IN THE AREA WHEN COAL MINING DECLINED,MASS UNEMPLOYMENT FOLLOWED.IN 1936 THE GOVERNMENT MADE RHONDDA A SPECIAL AREA AND TRIED TO BRING NEW INDUSTRY HERE WHERE THERE WAS ALREADY A POOL OF LABOUR.ONE SUCH FACTORY WAS BUILT BY THE GOVERNMENT AT YNYSWEN, TREORCHY,IN 1939.ALFRED POLIKOFF SET UP A CLOTHING FACTORY HERE EMPLOYING 1400.IT REACHED A PEAK OF 1500 IN THE 60'S,1985_400.NOW RHONDDA IS STILL A DEVELOPMENT AREA RECEIVING MAXIMUM GVT. ASSISTANCE.THE W.D.A. AND COUNCIL HAVE BUILT ADVANCED FACTORIES ON FORMER COLLIERY SITES.THESE VARY IN SIZE AND BUSINESS.AN OLD CINEMA HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO A NUMBER OF SMALL FACTORY UNITS: A PRINTING BUSINESS AND A FURNITURE SALESROOM.{UNEMPLOYMENT IS {A MAJOR PROBLEM.}
